#summary Usability Checklist

= Details =

1. Does it conform the way user interact with the web? Does it focus on the activity instead of specific audience?

2. Does it have only those features that are absolutely necessary for users to complete the activity the application is meant to support?

3. Does it support user's mental model of what it does?

4. Does it help users get started quickly so they can become intermediate users as soon as possible?

5. Does it make it easy to recover from mistakes and difficult to make them in the first place?

6. Does it have uniformly designed software interface elements, but leverages irregularity to create meaning and importance

7. Does it reduce a clutter to a minimum?

Reference: http://www.amazon.com/Designing-Obvious-Common-Approach-Application/dp/032145345X
